mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Peyton, Francis
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Declines appointment of marshal for district of Potomac; comports neither with its interest nor convenience; is actively engaged in commerce; smallness of interest [salary] almost preludes idea of obtaining deputy of integrity unless he be entitled to emoluments derived from office; appreciates honor of offer.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1801 May 25, Alexandria, [Virginia] to [Thomas Jefferson], [Washington D.C.].
